inn1.comm: nice start, good line outside off stump and it carries at a good height through to Matt Prior
closer to off stump and Amla defends into the covers
beaten as he plays a rather loose prod without much footwork and the ball fizzes past the outside edge
on the body, Amla whips it through midwicket with a neat turn of the wrists and there's a misfield from Mahmood running round from mid on which gives a second run
lovely shot, full delivery outside off and Amla leans into a strong square drive which finds the gap between backward point and cover...the outfield looks quick
left alone to end the opening over, bounces at head height to Prior so something there for the quicks
pushed across Smith outside off and a hint of movement back into the left hander as he leaves alone
driven firmly into the covers, he's away with a quick single to the right of mid-off
too wide outside off from Bresnan, but more encouraging bounce through to the keeper
better line, tight on off stump, Amla defends from the crease back down the pitch
thick outside edge forcing off the back foot, flies down to third man, decent line from Bresnan to Amla who can be vulnerable playing away from his body
bat and pad together, covering for any swing, defended into the covers
nearly done by the inswing, moves late into Smith who gets a thick inside edge down to fine leg...Bresnan thought he was nearly through there
back of a length outside off, Amla stands tall and punches to point

played off the back foot again, takes the inside half of the bat into the leg side...Amla takes a scampered single to mid on and it would have been tight if Mahmood had hit the one stump he had to aim at
tries the outswinger to the left hander for the first time, Smith defends straight down by his feet
on off stump and defended into covers
goes a touch fuller on off stump, Smith comes forward and defends to mid off
pushed across outside off, not far off being a wide but it's within the little white markings so Anderson is fine
handsome drive, Bresnan goes full searching for the swing and Amla threads it through the covers
drags the length back, Amla onto the back foot and forced to the left of mid off
driven firmly into the covers
walks across the crease outside off, works the ball down to mid on...you could see all the stumps behind Smith's legs
solid defence into the covers
plays the ball late and angles it down to third man to keep the strike
another outswinger to Smith who pushes it square to backward point
goes across to off stump, defends into the covers
whipped away from off stump through square leg with sweet timing, but there's a risk in that shot with the ball swings
too straight this time, turned through the leg side and it doesn't look like being a boundary before Eoin Morgan makes a hash of it on the boundary by grabbing at fresh air
corrects his line, back outside off, defended down to backward point
full on off stump, Smith onto the front and drives firmly...cover parries it towards mid off and prevents any runs
flashes and misses outside off, there was width on offer from Bresnan but Amla didn't get into position
takes the thigh pad down into the leg side
he's timing it nicely, pushed off the back foot and cover is on the edge of the circle so there's an easy single
driven straight to cover
wide from Bresnan but a great save by Paul Collingwood at backward point as Smith slashes a square cut in his direction

there's the breakthrough, good line outside off, Smith pushes with a half-open face and sends a comfortable edge to first slip...he was trying to steer that to third man, but the ball was too close to him
outside off and flies through to the keeper
another edge shoots down to third man as Amla forces off the back foot...might have been wide of third slip if he'd been in there
that's a cracker - Amla at his best - as he drives at the top of the bounce square through the off side
too straight as Anderson tries to compensate, turned into the leg side
he's away first ball with as he opens the face down to third man
full on off stump, encouraging the drive again but this time it picks out mid off
adjusts well to the right hander, on off stump and defended into the covers
bat and pad together, played solidly into the covers
tight on off stump, de Villiers makes half a stride into the shot and defends square on the off side
turns this into the leg side straight to midwicket
pushed down to mid on as Bresnan maintains a testing line
touch more width allows de Villiers to run this down to third man wide of second slip
outside off and left alone...still a hint of swing
driven into the covers

that's a Collingwood special...he marks becoming England's most capped ODI player by pulling off a blinder at backward point as de Villiers cuts in the air. It came out of the middle, but Collingwood dived to his left and got both hands to the catch...that's a wicket for the fielder
he's greeted by a bouncer, but it's too far down leg side and Anderson will have to bowl that again
very short and very loopy, well over Duminy's head and Prior does well to collect
back on a good length, Duminy defends into the leg side
well bowled, fuller on off stump with a hint of movement away and Duminy defends without much footwork
top shot, he leans elegantly into a cover drive with just a push...Pietersen chases hard and pulls off a good save at the rope
almost squared up by a touch of extra bounce, lobs into the off side but very safe
worked off the stumps down to long leg
good length, defended into the covers
not much footwork on that occasion as he drives confidently into the covers
banged in short, Amla ducks underneath
too straight this time, turns his wrists to guide the ball down to long leg
good start, takes the outside edge but lands short of second slip
lovely punch down the ground for a boundary
driven past mid on, too full from Mahmood and another elegant shot from Duminy who looks in good touch
defended into the covers
tries to work it away on the leg side but misses and takes one on the body
left alone outside off stump
banged in short, Amla ducks underneath one as Bresnan tests him again with a bouncer
pushed back to the pitch to Bresnan
beautiful forcing short through point, comes on to the front foot and drives square through the off side, another elegant boundary from Amla
good response from Bresnan, Amla is beaten as he tries to force off the back foot
short one from Bresnan down the leg side and he'll have to bowl that one again
good line and length to finish the over
pushed into the off side, back of a length from Mahmood
good length on off stump Duminy plays with a straight bat back towards Mahmood
left alone outside off stump, angling across the left hander
back of length again from Mahmood as Duminy defends towards cover
flashing blade, over pitched and wide from Mahmood and Duminy threads it through extra cover for a boundary
full on the stumps but Duminy picked out mid on with his punchy drive
Good start, back of length outside off and Amla inside edges
short again and Amla moves across his stumps to work it to leg with a flick of the wrists
defended into the off side
good length ball which Duminy drives airily towards Pietersen at mid off, a little early on the shot there
defended to cover, this is a decent start from Wright
fuller length, Duminy plays around his front pad a tad to knock the ball to mid off
better line from Mahmood, on off stump and Amla can only defend towards cover
full length delivery which Amla drives towards mid on
banged in again but not called wide, Amla ducks underneath easily enough
another good ball from Mahmood, on off stump and Amla can't beat mid off
good shot as Amla stands tall and leans on an off side punch through point, Morgan fields well to save the boundary, making up for his earlier mistake
inside edge on to his pad as Amla tries to flick it away
shortish turned around the corner for a single
sharp single could have been tight if Anderson's throw hit the stumps
good line from Wright, just outside off stump and Duminy can only defend that
another short ball, slightly quicker than Duminy imagined and he top edges for a lucky boundary
Duminy advances at Wright who drops it slightly shorter again in response and Duminy forces towards point
On off stump and Amla defends to cover
Amla walks across his stumps to flick a fullish ball from off stump through midwicket
loud appeal from England, short ball on leg stump clips the thigh pad on the way through to Prior
Duminy stands tall and works a back-of-a-length delivery towards third man
great fielding from Anderson saves a boundary as Amla climbs into a half-volley on off stump
interesting shot, Amla gets down on one knee and tennis-slaps a length ball for a single out to midwicket
Amla squirts a length ball on off stump through point
driven  sweetly but straight to mid off
Duminy turns a short ball towards mid wicket and the batsmen take a sharp single
short ball that Amla ducks underneath
a good ball on off stump angled down towards point and sharp fielding prevents the single
dropped Strauss drops a sitter at short extra. Duminy was too early on his drive. He's on 23 and that could hurt England
follows up with a wide
Duminy angles a shortish ball to third man to get off strike
Amla works a full ball from middle stump through mid wicket
single out to deep square leg
slower ball to finish from Mahmood, which Amla slashes towards third man where sharp fielding saves a boundary
short ball turned around the corner towards fine leg
pushed off the back foot out to deep cover
Duminy picks out deep cover as he cuts through the off-side
dug in short again, Amla pulls in the air towards deep square but landed safely
pushed down towards mid on
good line on off stump defended into the off side
helped down the ground
tossed up on middle, worked into the leg side
swept from outside off to deep square-leg
short and wide outside off, cut away through backward point and Eoin Morgan touches the rope at the same time as the ball as he tries to make a diving save
nicely bowled on off stump, driven down the ground to long off
the left hander sweeps again but this time finds Strauss at short fine leg
cramps Amla for room, defended back down the pitch, a consistent line from Wright
on off stump, tries to work into the leg side but can't get it away
whipped nicely away from leg stump
on off stump, dropped into the off side and the fielders are in quickly
worked off the stumps behind square, Duminy looks for two but Prior chases hard and keeps them to a single
well bowled again from Wright, nips back into Amla as he tries to work to the leg side and the ball lobs towards backward point
worked from off stump with the turn down to long on
this time Amla drives neatly down to long off
turned into the square-leg area, they set off for a quick single and have to hurry as the throw comes into the none-striker's end
tossed up on the stumps, drives down the ground to bring up his fifty from 61 balls and South Africa's 100
excellent innovation from Duminy, brings out the reverse sweep against Rashid's googly and collects a boundary through third man
and now he goes over the leg side, gets down and sweeps up and over deep square-leg to collect the first six of the day...pressure back on Rashid
shapes back into Amla, worked into the leg

big breakthrough for England...Wright rewarded for a probing spell as Duminy pushes outside off and gets a thin, low edge through to Matt Prior. Like Smith, he was trying to find third man and pays the price
defended into the covers
extra bounce from back of a length, Petersen gets into line and works it neatly down to long leg
jumps into line, plays the ball at the top of the bounce and works it through square leg
on off stump, defended into the covers to end a good over
big full toss, Petersen gets down and paddle-sweeps through square leg
driven into the covers
can't find the gap as he picks out cover
tossed up outside off, an expansive square drive goes straight to the deep sweeper
left alone outside off, hint of spin for Rashid
big stride forward, drives very correctly through extra cover and the sweep has to run round to collect
punched back down the pitch, Wright dives to his right in his follow through and makes an superb save
worked down towards mid on, Pietersen is deep and it's a safe single
whipped from middle and leg, more good timing out to deep square-leg
dragged down short and a little too leg side, pulled down to long leg
timing and placement from Petersen, short again from Wright and it sits up nicely...Petersen picks the gap between long leg and deep square-leg with precision
works the ball off the stumps through the leg side and sharp running makes it into a brace
turned away through the leg side
on off stump, defended back down the pitch
big appeal from Collingwood for leg before, looks close but there's a hint of inside edge and Brian Jerling thinks it's also drifting down leg side...gee, the replays look close
pushed out to deep cover
dropped that's the second chance England have put down today, Amla playing early and done by a lack of pace but Collingwood can't hold on in his follow through

this time he's gone! The ball after being given a life and it's almost an action replay...Amla plays early and is done by a lack of pace and a touch of tennis-ball bounce, this time the chance goes to short cover where Strauss holds on
good start, outside off stump, pushed back to the bowler
comes forward and defends
worked up to mid-on
offers up some width this time, allows Petersen to free his arms with a drive through the covers
down the leg side, picked off fine by McLaren and he's swift between the wickets
worked out to short midwicket
on middle stump, defended back towards Collingwood
excellent work from Anderson at midwicket, the ball was whipped off the stumps and he dived full length to prevent a single and almost create a run out
more good fielding, this time by Pietersen at backward point as he intercepts a strong square drive
picks out midwicket again as takes another one off middle stump
he can't do much with Collingwood at the moment, defended into the leg side
still no maidens today as Petersen finally finds a gap down to long on
driven into the covers
worked off the stumps through midwicket
driven firmly towards mid off when Bresnan pulls off a good diving save
can't beat the bowler on this occasion
pushed out to midwicket
can't find the gap past backward point...another tight over
worked off the hip out through square leg and Collingwood isn't happy that they came back for a second
handsome, crunching blow to relieve the pressure...Petersen takes a step down the pitch and drives high over mid-off. As we know, the ball carries a long away
nurdled into the leg side
leading edge as McLaren tries to go through the leg side, lobs away from cover and bobbles down to long off
dropped square on the off side, good running as this pair have seemed to have settled a little
slower ball, 59mph, defended carefully back to the bowler
full ball worked out towards mid wicket
slower ball, if Trott could get any slower, and wicket to mid on
on off stump, gentle, and hit to mid off
waited on it and worked a ball just outside off stump to third man, classic one-day cricket
looser ball on leg stump flicked out to deep square
on leg stump worked away to square leg, to complete a decent, if forgettable, over
dropped tough chance back to Anderson, stuck out his left hand and it brushed his fingers. Again the ball stopped on the wicket a tad and the batsman played too early
angled down towards third man
driven into the covers for an easy single
the bowling change works, as McLaren goes for a flashy drive well outside off stump but can only feather one through to Prior
starts with firm push to cover
finds the gap this time on the off side Luke Wright sprints across the cover boundary to prevent a four
another drive straight to cover of a full ball
slower still from Trott and Petersen can't get that away
shorter ball should have gone for four but Morgan scoots across the mid wicket boundary to keep it to one
72mph just outside off stump and Morkel inside edges
yorker length which Morkel can only dig out
worked down to long on, another good over from Trott
sharper from Anderson on off stump which Morkel angles down to third man for a single
shorter and wider, Petersen cuts strongly down to the point boundary where Trott does the fielding
bouncer which sticks in the pitch a little and Morkel avades without problem
another ball comes off a little slowly from the pitch and is worked through the leg side
fuller length driven back down the pitch
dragged down and pulled away to midwicket for a single
Trott contines his good work, holding a decent line and length
very slowly bowled, his mystery off-spinner, prodded into the off side
on off stump again
drifts slightly straighter and is worked for a single on the leg side
just outside off stump and again finds the fielder
shorter, wider, slower but mistimed towards to cover boundary for a single
starts with a Trott-esque medium pacer on off stump, which is prodded to point
great catch! dragged down from Collingwod and Morkel's swipe to deep square-leg is slightly mistimed. Morgan timed his jump perfectly to hold an excellent catch.
angled through backward point, just past the fielder for a single
good ball on off stump defended into the off side
slightly fuller, which allows Petersen a drive, but he picks out mid off
short ball is pulled away strongly from outside off stump to the midwicket boundary
Trott continues with his military off stump bowling, defended to cover
drilled to mid off
pushed out into the covers
big appeal, another slower ball and Petersen plays too early and is struck on the thigh, a bit high
dropped Boucher's drive just carries to a diving Strauss but the impact of hand on ground knocked the ball out. England's fourth drop.
worked out to mid wicket

massive appeal from Collingwood looking for his 100th ODI wicket, Boucher lunges forward defending and Collingwood thought it was pad before bat. Replays show it was very close but probably a fair decision.
clipped into the gap at midwicket
couldn't find the gap in the field
pushed out towards backward point
half edge and half guide towards third man
for the first time in this spell, Trott loses his line towards and is clipped towards fine leg and where Rashid is too square to cut off the boundary.
driven down the ground
defended square to cover
worked into the leg side
worked round the corner on the leg side
dropped, would you believe it, Strauss has put down his third for the day and his second complete dolly. Another drive lobs in his direction at short cover and somehow he goes to ground
pushed towards backward point, could be a tight run but despite a direct hit Boucher is safe
well fielded by Pietersen at backward point to cut off any runs
places this one into the covers to rotate the strike
play and miss outside off as he tries to guide towards third man
starts with a good yorker, dug out through square leg
worked off leg stump into the on side
still in accumulation mode as they bide their time before the final Powerplay
driven out through the covers to the deep sweeper, brings up his fifty off 57 balls...the second of his career
targeting the yorker again, searching for any late swing, and all Boucher can do is drive down to long off
opens the face and angles towards third man, doesn't get much pace on the ball...six singles in the over, England won't mind that
poor start, leg-stump full toss that is tickled down to fine leg...all it needed was a small piece of bat on it
that's better, on middle and sensibly worked towards mid on by Petersen
jumps across the crease and works into the leg side
angling into the pads, worked down the ground through mid on and good running brings two although the deep fielder was a little slow
pushed into the covers
what a beauty...almost out of nowhere. Boucher is beaten all ends up by one that holds its line and zips past the outside edge
he too concedes a boundary first up, searching for a yorker and it comes out as a full toss which Petersen whips through midwicket
chopped down to short third-man

half an appeal from Bresnan as the ball bobbles into the off side, but he's quickly into fielding mode as he tries to effect a direct hit at the non-striker's end but Boucher cleverly runs the line of the throw
gone! Timely breakthrough from Bresnan, a good delivery beats Petersen as he looks to guide the ball away and clips the top of the stumps
driven on the bounce to backward point
can't get off the mark as he pushes firmly into the covers
another low full toss and another first-ball boundary, turned away through midwicket as Anderson searches for a yorker
dropped down square on the off side, well taken quick single
full on middle and leg, worked comfortably towards mid on who is on the edge of the circle
pushed out square on the off side, all England's inner fielders are deep so there's a single every time
hint of late swing from a good length, squares up van der Merwe as he pushes to cover
gets away with a full toss this time, van der Merwe can only pick out midwicket
tucked off the stumps into the gap at midwicket
excellent shot from Boucher, he's the key now, as he goes over cover with a strong drive...didn't quite come out of the middle but had enough power on it
good response from Bresnan, cramps Boucher for room and he can only defend back to the bowler who fields in his follow through
again Boucher misses out as he tries to work to the leg side, the ball takes the pad back towards Bresnan
drives strongly but without much timing straight to mid off
dropped square on the off side for an easy single
angled out square towards point...England happy to give up the singles
worked from middle and off down to long on

gone...England continue to chip away and Anderson collects his third, although it wasn't a great ball as van der Merwe clips a leg-stump delivery straight into the hands of midwicket on the edge of the ring
tucked neatly into the square-leg area as Steyn opens his account
opens the face and collects one to short third man...no major damage for England in the shape of boundaries
another single into the covers
pushed back to Bresnan who sticks out a right hand in his follow through
drops and runs to backward point, would have been out if Collingwood had managed a direct hit but his throw is way off
guided down to third man
flies off the top of the pad to backward point, England appeal for the catch but don't get any joy as Steyn steals a leg bye
heaved through the leg side
turned through square leg
oh dear, oh dear...fires down a beamer which almost takes Steyn's head off and then Mahmood ends up in a heap on the ground with a leg problem...looks like cramp
manages to pitch this one, width outside off and Steyn picks out deep cover
slower ball which is dragged down, Boucher just waits long enough on his shot and pulls through square leg
picks up another slower ball, launches it over long on but Collingwood came in too far off the boundary as the ball flies over his head
worked into the leg side
another slower ball dragged down short and Boucher swats it through midwicket
ooh, that might be a harsh call as Mahmood sends down a slower-ball bouncer which Steyn doesn't play at
well, the extra ball allows him to end with a wicket as Steyn tries to heave over midwicket and doesn't get any real distance on the shot
gives himself room outside leg and launches a power drive towards mid off...Mahmood makes the save, but then stretches that troublesome leg again
gets away with a short ball, Boucher middled his pull but it goes one bounce to Morgan at deep square-leg
drags the length back and Langeveldt misses a huge swing across the line
backs away to the leg side again and hammers a cracking shot square through the off side for a valuable boundary
slower ball, well bowled, and that should have been a wicket but a labouring Mahmood moved late from mid off and didn't get there
low full toss swung out through midwicket straight to the man on the fence to end the innings on 250

inn2.comm: top start, pace and bounce on this one as it shapes away past Trott's outside...South Africa will like the look of that
good carry again, Steyn already up at 87mph, as Trott judges this one and leaves alone
a touch fuller and Trott gets bat on ball as he defends from the crease back to the bowler
quickly onto a slightly shorter ball but doesn't really get hold of it and picks out midwicket
good line outside off stump, Trott defends at the top of the bounce towards backward point
nice away shape on a full delivery, but Trott plays it well with soft hands to drop the ball into the off side to get the chase underway
back of a length, Trott stands tall and defends firmly into the covers
driven firmly towards mid off, Trott sets off for a quick single and van der Merwe makes an athletic one-handed dive at mid-off but Trott was always safe
first ball for the captain, defended from off stump back down the pitch
hint of width and Strauss launches into a fierce cover drive - he is in fine form - but hits it straight at cover
back of a length, Strauss defends into the covers
pushed across the left hander, left alone outside off
pushed firmly off the back foot into the covers
what a beauty from Steyn, boy that did Trott completely as he lifted sharply off a length and rose past the outside edge through to Boucher. Just too good
nice response from Trott, excellent intent as he latches onto a shot ball and pulls it through midwicket...he likes a battle
back on a full length at off stump, Trott defends back to Steyn to shapes to throw but doesn't bother...the crowd like it, this will be a good duel for the next two months
gets onto the front foot to a full delivery and drives to cover
opens the face a touch as he again plays into the off side
short and wide, which is meat and drink for Strauss as he gets going with a back-foot square drive through point
slower ball, defended with an open face to backward point
dropped into the off side, excellently played with soft hands and good running
plays the flat-batted pull again but doesn't get the same timing or power on this one and gets a single between mid on and midwicket
confidently driven on the up towards mid off
for once Strauss misses a cut, the ball was a little closer to him this time and he was a little cramped for room
another crackerjack delivery from Steyn, nips back between bat and pad as Trott comes across the crease and tries to work the ball to leg
pushed into the leg side as Trott gets to enjoy Steyn from the other end
dropped a little short and Strauss has no problem pulling it away through square leg...once again, the captain is looking in prime form
defended into the off side
on leg stump, neatly turned away down to long leg
slower ball drifts onto leg stump, clipped away to deep square-leg
Short ball which Trott pulls down to fine leg
Strauss advances down the track and slaps it to cover
advances again but this time threads it through the field to find the extra cover boundary, good intent from the England captain
lucky for Strauss as, on the walk again, he under edges a pull shot through to Boucher
this time he stays in his crease and drops a shortish ball on to the off side
good finish from Langeveldt as a Strauss can only block a straighter delivery towards cover
worked out to square leg for a single
a fuller ball from Steyn, Strauss hangs back in his crease and edges one along the ground to a diving slip
to close to Strauss has flashes at fresh air outside off stump
blocked into the off side
Strauss uses his feet again, coming at Steyn but his mistimed drive is cut off at cover
steps across the crease, worked into the leg side
whipped from outside off into the leg side but straight to midwicket
nicely turned from a leg-stump line down to fine leg
good bouncer from Langeveldt, Strauss thinks about a pull but pulls out at the last minute as the ball gets a little high to control the shot
cut away hard to backward point

big breakthrough as Strauss goes, he tries to work the ball into the leg side but gets a leading edge that loops gently to backward point. A little more bounce played a part in that, but he was also early on the shot
outside off, defended into the off side
advances down the pitch and outside leg stump, drives to backward point
lovely shot from Trott, he moves to the off side and down the track then whips the ball over short fine-leg
a well-timed square drive but straight to backward point
taken from off stump into the leg side where short midwicket fields
well, well...goes down the leg side and there's a noise which gets the South Africans very excited but the umpire calls it a wide. A few hands on heads
worked out to midwicket
Pietersen drives his first ball confidently to mid off
a good ball outside of stump is left firmly alone
fuller length from Langeveldt, Pietersen tries to whip it into the leg side but misses and the ball clips his pad
slower ball which is defended
too full from Langeveldt, on leg stump he's punished him through mid wicket
another slower ball, prodded out into the offside
knocked out into the off side
slightly fuller and Trott works it to mid on
good ball from McLaren, dragging Trott across his crease as its defended to cover
shorter and much quicker, 91mph, Trott pulls out of a pull shot
shoved down the leg side
on leg stump again and clipped down to deep square-leg for a single
starts with a horrid wide down the leg side
short and gentle and pulled away easily through midwicket
too short again, Trott dabs it down to third man
pitched up, Pietersen tries an expansive shot through the leg side but can only inside edge on to his leg stump. Big wicket for South Africa and for Morkel
defended into the off side
shovelled down to long leg
defended out to cover but he over steps... and that means a free hit
the free hit doesn't cost Morkel as a yorker length delivery is dabbed rather tamely to point
defended out to cover
slightly fuller, Collingwood gets forward and drives into the off side
bottom edge could have dragged on to his stumps, again the lack of the pace in the pitch defeating the batsman
thrown well outside off stump
slightly straighter and allows Colllingwood his favourite leg-side shovel for a single
good line for Trott outside off stump and he mistimes a push out towards cover
full length and a good off-stump line, Collingwood can only defend back to the bowler
pushed out to point and the batsmen cross for a single
Trott walks across his stumps, plays around his front pad, working a fuller ball out to deep square leg
short ball allows Collingwood to pull out to deep midwicket
mistimed through the leg side, Trott takes his bottom hand of the bat as he goes through the shot
Collingwood advances and heaves out to the leg side for a single
another good straight ball from McLaren which can only be driven towards mid on
tight line outside just outside off stump, defended to point
slightly too much width allows Collingwood to cut to the point boundary where Amla was quickly round to prevent a third, despite a fumble
defended back to the bowler
tries to nurdle it to leg but a diving stop for de Villiers prevents a single
pace of the ball keeps Collingwood stuck and he prods into the leg side
good full ball can only be defended back to the bowler
defended out to point
slightly shorter, Trott tries to force it to leg but finds the fielder
driven out to cover
Trott works a full ball from off stump through mid on for a single, he really favours the leg side
shorter and slightly quicker, Collingwood stands tall and defends out to the led side
defended out to leg
tries to work it to leg but misses
well fielded off his own bowling prevents a run
nudged into the leg side
fired down the leg side, Trott misses an attempted sweep. It hits the pad, harsh on van der Merwe
again down the leg side, this one clearer
defended out on the off side
Trott misses an attempted cut as the ball turned slightly
worked away for a single
tight line from McLaren, Trott tries to force it out towards leg but loses his bottom hand
too short, allows Trott to pull easily behind square and that eases the tension slightly
defended out to the off side
fuller and slightly straighter, driven out to long on
defended out to cover again, McLaren bowling good lines here
driven confidently but only finds the fielder at mid off
full length, gets the inside half of the bat
dabbed behind square on the off side for a single
inside edge again as Collingwood tries to force it through mid wicket. Collingwood a tad stuck here
single out to long off
drives firmly to Steyn at mid off, sharp single but the throw just misses the stumps.
defended out to cover
Trott waits and dabs the ball out to point with soft hands
fuller ball turned round the corner for a single
well wide of leg stump
just a bit to short, allows an easy forcing shot off the back foot through mid wicket
a nurdle into the leg side for a very gentle single
Good tight lines from Morkel
on off stump and Collingwood drives to cover
Trott uses the hint of width to angle the ball down to third man
Collingwood repeats the shot and the batsmen cross
good stuff from Morkel, Trott can only defend into the off side
slightly fuller and Trott steps across his towards the off side to loft the ball into the leg side, good incisive batting
driven down to long off
worked through midwicket
well placed by Collingwood through backward point as he opens the face with a drive
pushed gently up to mid off
floated on leg stump, work through the leg side again...score ticking along in this over
placed along the ground down to long on
defended down by his feet, bobbles around the popping crease
cracking up the speed, 94mph, and Collingwood is taken on the shoulder as he goes for a pull
full on middle and punched down to long on
good pace from Steyn, 91mph, and it's defended into the covers
aggression from England's senior pro, launches a short ball high over midwicket with a strong pull and it bounces across the rope
back-to-back boundaries as Steyn drifts full on leg stump this time, Collingwood clips it sweetly along the ground this time but in the same direction as the previous shot
worked into the leg side, van der Merwe skips across to field
finds the gap at midwicket this time with a turn of the wrists
over the wicket, punched down the ground to long off
full outside off, forced away through the covers and well placed for a second
squeezed into the point area
opens the face and picks up another run to backward point
stays on the back foot and finds the gap at cover
cut into the ground and bounces up to backward point

chipped in the air over midwicket, they come back for a second and Trott - who is troubled by some cramp - really has to get a shift on as throw comes in. Boucher demolishes the stumps and it goes to the third umpire, but Trott's dive made sure he got in
punched off the front foot through the covers
defended out to short cover
uses his feet and actually ends up yorking himself as he digs the ball out to midwicket
on leg stumped, worked out through square leg and that takes Trott to his first ODI half century from 73 balls
dragged down short, pulled away out to deep square
ticking the score over comfortably with another single into the leg side
well played, but another poor ball as van der Merwe offers up a leg-side half-tracker which Collingwood helps down to fine leg
advances and punches back to the bowler
tucked into the leg side...another good over for England
takes some pace off the ball, 77mph, on off stump and defend to the off side
comes down the pitch but misses his pull and is taken on the body
the attacking approach continues from Collingwood, he uses his feet and aims over mid on but misses and isn't far from losing his off stump
tight line on off stump but it's a no ball and it's a free hit
and this time England make the most it...that's how to play a free hit as Collingwood leans back and launches a full ball high over long on into the stands
tucked neatly off the pads and he keeps the strike
outside off, defended square on the off side
pushed back down the pitch
uses his feet and chips beautifully over midwicket...almost finds the gap, but long makes a diving save on the rope
worked down to long on
waits on the back foot and places this gently down the ground
short outside off but Collingwood misses out on his cut
once again he loses his line down the leg side...van der Merwe looks a bit miffed at the moment
pushed into the off side
turned from outside leg stump towards short fine leg
beautifully bowled, that's his best delivery as he beats Collingwood with one that grips and spins past the outside edge
down the pitch, almost beaten in the air, but manages to hoick it down past short fine leg to reach another one-day fifty from 64 balls
defended into the off side
short and cut away square through the covers
round the wicket, pushed into the off side
goes back in the crease and turns it through square leg
swept off about middle stump towards deep square-leg
slog-swept out to deep midwicket
nurdled, in typically Colly style, through midwicket
easy as you like for Trott to collect another single to long on
inside edge into his pad trying to turn to leg
another short ball from the struggling van der Merwe and Trott is quickly onto it as he pulls through midwicket
drifting onto leg stump, tucked through the leg side
fired in full, punched down to long off
some very slow turn means Trott can wait on the back foot and whip this through midwicket
pushed into the leg side
meets it on the full and turns it to leg for another single
defended back to the bowler
150 up, worked into the leg side
good ball defended into the off side
shapes up for a big shot but bunts it into the leg side for a single instead
prodded into the off side
pushed out comfortably into the off side
another single, van der Merwe being milked here
outside the off stump driven through the covers
tries to cut but misses, lapse in concentration
worked into the leg side
worked into the leg side straight to the fielder
couple of steps down the track and nurdled with soft hands into the leg side
horrible attempted reverse-sweep gets the top edge but falls short of third man
sharp delivery, just short of a length and defended into the off side
played and missed outside off stump as Smith urges more from South Africa
shorter delivery dragged from outside off stump in the air to the mid on boundary
away swinger beats Collingwood's flat-footed poke
slightly fuller and Collingwood drives straight to mid off
shorter this time, Collingwood's cut is intercepted by a diving point. Good start from Steyn but he'll need a wicket soon.
starts with a short one that Collingwood heaves towards the midwicket boundary
Trott walks slightly across his stumps again and drivesa full ball to long on
fuller and wider from McLaren, Collingwood throws his bat at it but it comes off the toe
short, wide and slashed past point for four
good response from McLaren, tighter on the stumps and fuller, Collingwood can only force down the ground
Trott keeps things ticking over with a single down the ground
good ball, back of a length and defended to mid on
defended again, this time out to cover
well stopped at backward point, keeps Collingwood on strike
slower ball outside off stump is driven past point for a single
worked towards mid on
another sharp ball from Steyn, Trott tries to run it down to third man but mistimes it. Good over from Steyn
and is immediately worked into the leg side
slower but slightly too short, and Collingwood cuts to point
attempted bouncer comes slowly off the pitch, Trott waits an age and times it between deep square-leg and fine leg for a boundary
fuller length driven to mid off
slower ball again, but a better line and length, defended by Trott
Trott works another ball from outside off stump through mid on for a single.
Trott hangs back to a ball on a good length and guides it towards the cover boundary
a smart piece of fielding by van der Merwe at cover prevents a single
good shot, skips down the tack and clears the infield with his drive through cover for an excellent boundary
ugly mow to a fuller ball gets the inside edge on to pad and the batsmen scurry through for a single as Steyn's kick misses the stumps
chopped down off the bottom half of the bat to third man
short ball is pulled through mid wicket, beats the infield and long on has to run around to do the fielding
massive appeal from Langeveldt. Short ball didn't get up and Trott missed his pull shot. It looks very close, possibly going over
clipped to mid wicket
clipped slightly squarer for a single
driven up to mid off who was deep enough to allow Collingwood a single
another short ball and Trott mistimes a work to leg, he looks a little jaded
this time it's Collingwood's turn to miss a legside force. Completes a good over for Langeveldt
worked into the square-leg area
low full toss but clipped straight to midwicket
top shot, outstanding batting from Collingwood and this shows his confidence as he skips down the pitch and lofts the ball over deep midwicket with a superbly-timed clip
now he rotates the strike with a leg-side single
worked to square leg, can't beat the field this time
very slow turn, Trott waits and places it up to long on
punched into the covers
dragged down short again, and again Trott connects with a terrific pull shot which comfortably beats deep square-leg into the fence
but it won't be Trott who gets one as he tries to clear the boundary with a lofted clip off his legs and instead picks out Hashim Amla at deep square-leg
worked to mid on
angled out to backward point
down the leg side, tucked off his hips towards fine leg...Morgan declines a second run
comes down the pitch and pushes up to mid off
defended into the off side
well, well this one scoots through low and almost takes out Morgan's off stump...hmm, this might be interesting
onto the front foot and pushed to the off side
gets a bottom edge as he tries to guide to third man...good over from McLaren pushes the asking rate back up a little
defended into the covers, excellent stuff from McLaren with just a single from the over
excellent start, pinpoint yorker on leg stump which Collingwood can only jab into the off side
hint of width allows Morgan to free his arms and he gets a think outside edge down to third man...no slips in and that eases the pressure
excellent shot from Morgan as he cuts through backward point, but a horror ball for South Africa as Steyn oversteps and third man misfields to concede the boundary...so it's free hit time
can't take advantage of a full toss as he clubs it straight to mid-on
another cracking yorker, Morgan does well to get his feet out of the way and the bat down in time...squeezes it out to deep square-leg
on leg stump, clipped down to fine leg
brilliant batting from Collingwood, he saw third man was inside the circle so upper cuts a short ball over his head and the fielder can't quite pull it in...clever thinking, great execution

moment of controversy here as Morgan gets a big full toss from McLaren and pulls it in the air to mid on where Morkel runs back to take the catch...but the height of the ball is an issue and after consulting with the TV umpire they decide it was over waist height
clipped off leg stump and goes very fine, but the fielder gets around in time so Collingwood moves to 98
uses his feet and pulls out to deep square, goes one bounce to the fielder
turned into midwicket where the fielder prevents a single
cuts and misses outside off
there he goes, Morgan in six-mode again as he goes down and sweeps a massive blow over deep square-leg...he has all the shots
goes straight down the ground this time, superb clean strike and it beats long off across the boundary...emphatic stuff from Morgan
and there's his hundred, clubbed wide of mid-on and he acknowledges warm applause from the few England fans in the ground and his team-mates...his fifth ODI hundred comes off 108 balls
big full toss and swung through the leg side
umpire Jerling has taken a blow as Morgan crunches another straight drive...that looks painful as it struck him on the ankle, just above where his shoes finish
another full toss which Collingwood nearly puts down the throat of deep square but it bounces in front
a full toss is clubbed straight to mid-on
and there's the victory, Morgan seals the game with a clip over midwicket and England are home with four overs to spare
